data.title: Data Management News & Analysis
data.meta_description: Coverage of data management techniques, data management technology innovation and financial services data challenges.
data.text:
News & Commentary

Financial Data Supply Chain, Part 2: Integration as the Ultimate Weapon

Commentary

An integrated financial data supply chain creates efficiencies through automation, openness, standards, and communication across the data supply chain from source to use, rather than simply passing data on and out of sight.By Stephen Engdahl Senior Vice President, Product Strategy, GoldenSource, 1/7/2015

Wall Street CIOs Have A Vendor Management Problem

If Wall Street CIOs want to stay ahead of competition and ensure that high-speed trading software doesn't start the next flash crash, they need better insight into vendor-delivered software. By Lev Lesokhin Executive VP, Strategy, CAST, 12/31/2014

Financial Data Supply Chain, Part 1: A Common Foe Requires a Common Language

Commentary

Many national financial markets have developed unique standards for how transactions, instruments, and entities are classified. As an inevitable result, things get lost in translation.By Stephen Engdahl Senior Vice President, Product Strategy, GoldenSource, 12/30/2014

Global Banks Need to Demonstrate RDA Progress in 2015

News

Capital Markets Outlook 2015: As the January 2016 deadline approaches for BCBS 239, also known as risk data aggregation, banks need to make sure they have a definitive RDA plan, and can show regulators they are getting closer to their compliance goals.By Greg MacSweeney Editorial Director, 12/18/2014

Financial Services Institutions Gear Up for Social Intelligence

News

Social media has mainly been a marketing effort in financial services, and many firms are not tracking ROI. Yet, some are deriving value from analysis of social data, whether it's sentiment analysis for trading or credit risk in lending.By Ivy Schmerken Editor at Large, 12/12/2014

Julio Gomez Joins Knowledgent as Industry Strategy Partner

News

Julio Gomez, the founder of Gomez Inc., has joined data analytics firm Knowledgent as industry strategic partner for financial services.By Greg MacSweeney Editorial Director, 12/4/2014

The Digital Trends for Data-Driven Markets in 2015 & Beyond

Commentary

Top marketing trends for social, mobile, advertising, and digital analytics, according to Teradata's Michael LummusBy Becca Lipman Senior Editor, 12/3/2014

Jefferies Selects Markit for TCA as a Neutral 3rd Party

News

As Jefferies beefs up its algorithmic trading business, the broker chose Markit to provide trading metrics and reports to the buy side.By Ivy Schmerken Editor at Large, 12/2/2014

Understanding Agricultural Data Means Standing in the Field

Commentary

Combining the best of new technology with good, old-fashioned walk-the-fields crop tours turns information into insight.By Corey Cherr Head of Agriculture and Weather Research and Forecasts, Lanworth, 12/2/2014

BNY Mellon Aims to Tap Data Science Talent In Silicon Valley

News

Looking for new ideas and talented data scientists, BNY Mellon has opened an innovation center in Palo Alto.By Greg MacSweeney Editorial Director, 12/2/2014

The Value of Predictive Analytics in Financial Services

Commentary

Risk management and customer data are two key areas where data analytics is being applied in financial services.By Ingo Mierswa CEO and Founder, RapidMiner, 11/26/2014

How Big Data Analytics Helps Financial Institutions Navigate Today’s Regulatory Maze

Commentary

As firms work to meet new regulatory reporting requirements and keep pace with constant change, it all comes down to harnessing data.By Drew Rockwell CEO , Lavastorm Analytics, 11/10/2014

The Inefficient Back Office: A Checklist of Pain Points

Commentary

Many firms consider their reconciliation process fully automated, but "automated" doesn't necessarily mean "efficient." By Ian Danic Executive Director, Electra Information Systems, 11/7/2014

Finance’s Role in Managing the Ever-Growing Volume, Variety & Velocity of Data

Commentary

Today's financial firms have done little to harness the power of big data analytics, finds Accenture, but CFOs are stepping in to help guide the organization and its future investments.By Scott Brennan Managing director of Accenture Strategy’s Finance & Enterprise Performance group, 11/6/2014

How Big Data Will Influence the Financial Space in 2015

Commentary

Without faster and better analysis and visualization tools, financial institutions will be unable to comprehend relationships or patterns that exist within the data, defeating the point of using it at all.By Al Nugent Chief Operating Officer , Adaptive Computing, 11/5/2014

Chief Data Officers: Organization Strategy & Cultural Change

Commentary

Chief data officers are new to the financial services C-suite, but they are facing a number of challenges, including the need for new data governance and execution strategies, staffing, and new organizational structures to enable cultural change.By Andrew Waxman Thought Leader, 10/21/2014

Micro Data Challenges in an Era of Macroprudential Regulation

Commentary

Research and statistical analysis experts at central banks are tasked with developing sophisticated forecasts and models to identify systemic risk. Yet they are spending most of their time acting as data entry clerks, rather than developing these models.By Ken Rossiter Senior Product Manager, SunGard's MarketMap, 10/20/2014

Teradata Highlights 'Data Driven' Strategy at PARTNERS 2014

News

In-memory efficiency and tools to identify contextual relationships across systems take center stage at Teradata annual PARTNERS conference.By Becca Lipman Senior Editor, 10/20/2014

The Perks of 'SmartSourcing' Shared Services in Financial Industry

Commentary

A breadth of vital but undifferentiated business processes are still being replicated across the industry. They are all candidates for centralization.By Michele Trogni Head of Enterprise Services at Markit, 10/17/2014

SIFMA Criticizes SIP Selection Process for Lack of Transparency

News

Citing conflicts of interest in the voting process for a key market data feed, SIFMA letter presses for answers and for brokers and asset managers to get a seat at the table.By Ivy Schmerken Editor at Large, 10/17/2014
